channel.title: Wrase Theme Demo
channel.description: Recent content on Wrase Theme Demo

item.title: About
item.description: Overviews of the blog:- Built with Hugo (static website generator); Chroma as the default syntax highlighter by Hugo; Emoji function with emojify which is built in Hugo. Applies web framework (layouts) produced by Semantic UI; Uses default icons shipped with Semantic UI framework (pretty much similar to Font Awesome); Utilizes grid system which is also provided by Semantic UI. Credit For The creation of this blog has been made possible, thanks to the contributions of:- Blackburn theme made by Yoshiharu Yamashita for the blog section layout; Timeline styling made by Michaela; & Back-to-top function.

item.title: 21 May 2017
item.description: Can a leopard hide anywhere? No, he is always spotted!

item.title: 17 May 2017
item.description: What is owned by you but mostly used by others? Your name!

item.title: 13 May 2017
item.description: Which is the place pencils like to go for a vacation? Pencil – vania!

item.description: How can you make a golden soup? Just add 24 carrots to the soup!

item.title: 11 Apr 2017
item.description: How can you make number seven to an even number? Just take the “s” out from it!

item.title: 01 Apr 2017
item.description: ... Patient: Doctor, please can you help me out? Doctor: Yes, you may make your way out the same way you come in.

item.title: A Hole in The Fence
item.description: In a small village, a little boy lived with his father and mother. He was the only son.The parents of the little boy were very depressed due to his bad temper. The boy used to get angry very soon and taunt others with his words. His bad temper made him use words that hurt others. He scolded kids, neighbours and even his friends due to anger. His friends and neighbours avoided him, and his parents were really worried about him.

item.title: Another Hugo Post
item.description:
TOML, YAML, JSON — Oh my!

One of the nifty Hugo features we should cover: flexible configuration and front matter formats! This entry has front matter in toml, unlike the last one which used yaml, and json is also available if that’s your preference.

item.title: Hello Hugo
item.description: Hello from Hugo! If you’re reading this in your browser, good job! The file content/post/hello-hugo.md has been converted into a complete HTML document by Hugo. Isn’t that pretty nifty? A Section Here’s a simple titled section where you can place whatever information you want. You can use inline HTML if you want, but really there’s not much that Markdown can’t do. Showing off with Markdown A full cheat sheet can be found here or through Google.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Goto hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your os and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step. More complete instructions are available at installing hugo Step 2. Build the Docs Hugo has its own example site which happens to also be the documentation site you are reading right now. Follow the following steps: Clone the hugo repository Go into the repo Run hugo in server mode and build the docs Open your browser to http://localhost:1313 Corresponding pseudo commands:
